title: Bug 6009 - New class wizard doesn't get context right for nested classes
description: When using the new class wizard to create nested classes, the context is not set correctly, causing issues with the generated code.
OB: When creating a new nested class using the class wizard, the generated code is not placed within the appropriate parent class.
EB: The new class wizard should correctly set the context for nested classes, ensuring that the generated code is placed within the correct parent class.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the new class wizard.
2. Choose the option to create a nested class.
3. Follow the prompts to specify the parent class.
4. Complete the wizard and examine the generated code to see if it is placed within the correct parent class.
